intro: Samolus junceus, commonly known as slender samolus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features slender, cylindrical stems that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Samolus junceus is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
